Module uk.gov.gchq.eventlogging
Package event.logging

Interface EventLoggingService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultEventLoggingService, MockEventLoggingService
    public interface EventLoggingService
    A service for recording audit events.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods

    • Method Detail

      • createEvent

        default Event createEvent()
        Creates an event that may have some common values set by default depending on the particular EventLoggingService implementation being used. If this method is not implemented it will return an empty event by default. Using createEvent(String, String, EventAction) should be preferred.
        Returns:
        An event that is ready to have additional properties set.

      • createEvent

        default Event createEvent​(java.lang.String typeId,
                          java.lang.String description,
                          EventAction eventAction)
        Creates an event that may have some common values set by default depending on the particular EventLoggingService implementation being used. If this method is not implemented it will return an event that contains only the supplied typeId, description and eventAction.
        Parameters:
        typeId - The typeId of the event, see EventDetail.setTypeId(String)
        description - The description of the event, see EventDetail.setDescription(String)
        eventAction - The action of the logged event, see EventAction
        Returns:
        An event that is ready to have additional properties set.

      • createEvent

        default Event createEvent​(java.lang.String typeId,
                          java.lang.String description,
                          Purpose purpose,
                          EventAction eventAction)
        Creates an event that may have some common values set by default depending on the particular EventLoggingService implementation being used. If this method is not implemented it will return an event that contains only the supplied typeId, description, purpose and eventAction. It also has the current time set on the event. It is expected that this method is implemented to provide an event with all common values set, e.g. system name, environment, device, etc.
        Parameters:
        typeId - The typeId of the event, see EventDetail.setTypeId(String)
        description - The description of the event, see EventDetail.setDescription(String)
        purpose - The justification for the action, see EventDetail.setPurpose(Purpose)
        eventAction - The action of the logged event, see EventAction
        Returns:
        An event that is ready to have additional properties set.

      • log

        void log​(Event event)
        Logs an event.
        Parameters:
        event - The event to log.

      • log

        default void log​(java.lang.String typeId,
                 java.lang.String description,
                 EventAction eventAction)
        Logs an event with the supplied typeId, description and EventAction. Makes use of createEvent(String, String, EventAction) to provide an event with other common values set.
        Parameters:
        typeId - The typeId of the event, see EventDetail.setTypeId(String)
        description - The description of the event, see EventDetail.setDescription(String)
        eventAction - The action of the logged event, see EventAction

      • log

        default void log​(java.lang.String typeId,
                 java.lang.String description,
                 Purpose purpose,
                 EventAction eventAction)
        Logs an event with the supplied typeId, description and EventAction. Makes use of createEvent(String, String, EventAction) to provide an event with other common values set.
        Parameters:
        typeId - The typeId of the event, see EventDetail.setTypeId(String)
        description - The description of the event, see EventDetail.setDescription(String)
        eventAction - The action of the logged event, see EventAction

      • loggedWorkBuilder

        EventLoggerBuilder.TypeIdStep loggedWorkBuilder()
        Creates a builder to assist with logging an event for a Runnable or Supplier. This method allows for a piece of work to be run and logged in one go with any exceptions being logged appropriately. By default if an exception is throw in the logged work then a failure outcome will be added to the
        Returns:
        A builder instance.

      • setValidate

        void setValidate​(java.lang.Boolean validate)
        Set to true if the event logging service should validate the output XML against the schema. This option helps identify areas of code that are producing invalid data. For performance reasons it is recommended that validation is not performed in production. If validate is set to null then the system property shall be used to determine if validation is performed.
        Parameters:
        validate - The validation flag.

      • isValidate

        boolean isValidate()
        Use to determine if the event logging service is set to validate output data against the XML schema.
        Returns:
        True if the validate flag is set.
